title: Unions of intervals in codes based on powers of sets
abstract:
We prove that for every integer $d \ge 2$ there exists a dense collection of
subsets of $[n]^d$ such that no two of them have a symmetric difference that
may be written as the $d$th power of a union of at most $\lfloor d/2 \rfloor$
intervals. This provides a limitation on reasonable tightenings of a question
of Alon from 2023 and of a conjecture of Gowers from 2009, and investigates a
direction analogous to that of recent works of Conlon, Kam\v{c}ev, Leader,
R\"aty and Spiegel on intervals in the Hales-Jewett theorem.
